items.a: Meso are plant-based drops used as a moderate daily ritual—more noticeable than a very light dose, yet still functional for everyday life. Think of it as the “sweet spot” between subtle and strong: a few drops, slow breaths, and ~10 minutes of unwind. Many people follow a simple rhythm (for example, 5–7 days on, 2–3 days off) to build consistency.

items.q: Can Meso help with sleep issues?
items.a: Some customers prefer to take Meso after lunch, as they’ve reported it can interfere with sleep. Others, on the contrary, have experienced more vivid dreams. Everyone is different, so pair your drops with healthy sleep habits (dim lights, no screens, gentle music) and see what works best for you.

items.q: How long does it take to see results?
items.a: Some people notice a shift within about 10–30 minutes of a dose; others feel benefits accumulate over a week or two with steady use. Treat it like a small daily practice; results and timing vary from person to person.

items.q: What’s the difference between microdosing and mesodosing?
items.a: Microdosing is often described as “just-below-perception.” Mesodosing is a touch more noticeable while remaining manageable for daily life, aimed at helping you stay present, notice patterns, and build new habits in real time.

founderLetter.title: A Letter from the Founder
founderLetter.author: Alvaro de Ferranti
founderLetter.body:
A Letter from the Founder
Why I’m Writing This
We are currently in 2025, but back in 2014, everything in my life had collapsed.
On the outside, I looked like a man holding it all together: businesses, responsibilities, family, momentum…but inside, I was running on fumes. Years of burnout had stripped away my energy and clarity, and a crippling addiction was grinding down what was left. Holidays didn’t fix it. Willpower didn’t fix it. Coffee didn’t fix it. When the crash came, it nearly broke me.
This letter is the story of what followed: how I met iboga, what it taught me, and why that journey led to Mesodosing and the tinctures we make today. It’s not a white paper. It’s not a miracle story. It’s a note from someone who learned, (slowly and sometimes painfully) how to stand back up.

Meeting Iboga
During the worst of spiral, I was pointed toward an obscure, West African shrub: Tabernanthe iboga. I didn’t approach it as a trend or a shortcut. I approached it like a drowning man reaching for a rope.
Across two separate full “flood” treatments, iboga/ibogaine changed the trajectory of my life. It interrupted my cravings, softened withdrawals, and, more importantly, gave me enough quiet to listen. 
Not to a guru, not to a program, but to the part of me that wanted to live differently. 
That grounding, insight and window of quiet didn’t solve everything, but it let me start.

What It Taught Me
Here’s the uncomfortable truth I discovered: no plant medicine is a one-step cure. 
Not iboga, not psilocybin, not ayahuasca. They can open a door…but you still have to walk through, and keep on showing up for yourself.
What iboga gave me was clarity. With that clarity, I could finally do the inner work: honest conversations, different choices, steadier routines. Healing wasn’t fireworks. It was the day-in, day-out business of living a little better than yesterday.

The Middle Path: 
Why Would You Not Want to Feel the Medicine?
After those intense, deep dives with iboga which took a week out of my life each time, I didn’t want to keep swinging between the extremes of either doing nothing or blasting off again. 
I wanted something steady. 
That’s where mesodosing came in.
Mesodosing lives in the middle. It isn’t the subtle whisper of microdosing, and it isn’t the thunderclap of a flood dose. It’s a sustainable, felt practice that supports real life: work, family, responsibilities, sleep. Measured, intentional and repeatable. A way to keep the gains without blowing up your week.

How the Tinctures Came to Be
From 2016 onward, I co-founded, ran, and oversaw ibogaine centres across Europe and Mexico. In that time, I learned a lot about what helps…and about what gets in the way. 
People needed something simple, consistent, and respectful of the plant. Something that fit ordinary days and busy seasons. Something you could integrate into a life you were actively building.
So, we went back to basics and created tinctures that keep the character of the root intact while making daily use straightforward. No gimmicks. No complicated stacks. Just clean formulations and clear intentions.
Three principles guided us:
1.  Simplicity: Fewer moving parts, more usable routines.
2.  Safety & Respect: Thoughtful dosing, quality sourcing, careful process.
3.  Empowerment: You remain in charge of your pace, your needs, your life.

The Core Products
Ibotincture TA
Our flagship tincture, made from Iboga Total Alkaloids. We chose TA because it carries more of the plant’s original “voice,” not just a single compound in isolation. It’s grounded, steady, and well-suited to mesodosing.
Ibotincture RB
Crafted from Iboga Root Bark. A faithful, unpretentious expression of the plant, formulated for people who prefer a gentler, earth-forward profile.
These two are the foundation. Everything else we make starts here.

The Companions
From the core tinctures, we developed simple pairings aimed at everyday needs: nothing flashy, just thoughtful combinations:
•  TANIA™ (TA + Niacinamide) Built with burnout in mind: steadiness, support, and a clearer “yes/no” to your day.

•  CLARA™ (TA + L-Theanine) Calm focus without edge. For deep work, difficult conversations, and softer evenings.

•  LUCIA™ (TA + Saffron) A brighter baseline. Gentle lift, warmer outlook, still very much you.
They’re companions, not crutches, like extensions of the same core idea: make support accessible, repeatable, and human.

What Mesodosing Looks Like in Real Life
It looks like choosing consistency over heroics. It looks like a few drops, taken twice a day, with intention, while you also:
•  Get sunlight in the morning.
•  Move your body most days.
•  Eat like you respect yourself.
•  Sleep like it matters (because it does).
•  Tell the truth—especially to yourself.
•  Ask for help when you need it.
Mesodosing isn’t the star of the show. You are. The tincture is there to steady your hand while you make the next right choice.

The Mesodose Movement
Healing thrives in community. We built the Mesodose Movement to give people a place to learn, share, and be seen. Not as patients or projects, but as humans doing the work. Micro can be too faint. Macro can be too much. Mesodose is the middle…sustainable, grounded, and kind to your nervous system.

A Note on Care
I’m not offering medical advice here. I am sharing what helped me and what I’ve seen help others. If you have health conditions or take medications, speak with a qualified professional who understands this space. Go slowly. Listen closely. Keep what serves; leave the rest.

Why I Still Believe
Because I know what it’s like to burn out.

I know what it’s like to slide into addiction and lose the plot.

And I also know how powerful it is to get back up, to build a life that doesn’t need saving every few months.
That’s what Mesodosing is for. 
Not to dazzle you. 
To steady you.

Be safe,
— Alvaro de Ferranti
